sentences: Ada Software Developer
Job title: Ada Software Developer
Location: New Malden, this role will be on site however there is flexibility of condensed hours
Salary: £40-£70K depending on experience and skills
What you’ll be doing:
Analyse software requirements, create software design updates to support software implementation, ensuring that the overall system will behave according to its requirements
Write software according to coding standards and maintain existing software by investigating issues and identifying pragmatic solutions
Write software test schedules and run them to test the system, demonstrating compliance with the requirements
Document appropriate information, so that others can understand the software and the system
Contribute to process improvement within the team to ensure that the team always looks to improve how it works
Liaise with other team members, teams and customers to ensure key information is understood
Your skills and experiences:
Essential:
Structured Software Design, using formal methods
Programming to coding standards: Ada
Software Integration & Testing
Familiarisation with Windows Operating System (Client & Server) and other COTS technologies
Desirable:
Other programming e
g
C++, C#, VB Script, Powershell
Familiarisation with virtualisation technologies e
g
VMWare
Benefits:
You’ll receive benefits including a competitive pension scheme, enhanced annual leave allowance and a Company contributed Share Incentive Plan
You’ll also have access to additional benefits such as flexible working, an employee assistance programme, Cycle2work and employee discounts – you may also be eligible for an annual leave incentive
The Software Development team:
The purpose of the role is to undertake a range of software development activities in line with relevant processes within the Submarine Command System (SMCS) projects/programmes

The SMCS system provides situation awareness (via Tactical Picture Compilation) and Weapons Management capability for all Submarines in the Royal Navy flotilla including the existing Trafalgar, Astute and Vanguard Class of submarines and future platform class Dreadnought
The project portfolio is valued in £millions and comprises programmes spanning all stages of the lifecycle from bidding through development, in-service support and disposal
The SMCS projects deliver to a number of customers within Industry and the MoD
The applicant would be expected to have prior experience of working on software development projects across all phases of the software development lifecycle
